name: "Pantry Find" Pasta for Two
author: Buckwheat Queen
summary: I came up with this pasta dish when cleaning out my pantry. It's savory, delightful, and doesn't require a lot of savvy and is quick to get on the table.
ingredients: 2 ounces sun dried tomatoes in oil, drained and chopped
1 (3 ounce) can tuna in water, drained
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet and saute shallot until soft and translucent, 3 to 5 minutes
Add olives, chopped tomatoes, and capers
Mix well and remove from heat
Drain pasta, add to the skillet, and toss to coat
Top with Romano cheese and serve
